hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation-Cluster Support Bounce
hypothesis_content.statement: A catalyst-driven price drop that triggers a concentrated cluster of long liquidations (e.g., '$600M in liquidations') will create a temporary but strong support level at the price point where the liquidation cascade decelerates sharply (>70% drop in liquidation volume over 2 hours). A bounce of at least 50% of the initial catalyst-driven drop will occur from this support within 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Massive liquidation events often represent a forced, non-fundamental clearing of leveraged positions. Once the forced selling exhausts, the absence of natural sellers at that level, combined with bargain-hunting and short covering, provides fuel for a technical bounce. The news explicitly mentions liquidations, highlighting this mechanism.
entry_conditions: Observe a peak in hourly long liquidation volume exceeding the 95th percentile of the last 30 days
Subsequent 2-hour total liquidation volume drops to <30% of that peak volume
Price consolidates for at least 2 hourly candles within a 1% range of the low established post-liquidation peak

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches a level equal to 50% of the range from the pre-catalyst high to the post-liquidation low
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the post-liquidation consolidation range low by >1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues to decline steadily on high volume after liquidations subside, indicating fundamental selling pressure outweighing the technical liquidation exhaustion.
